title: Ground News - The West's hostility to the Arabs from the Crusades to the flood of Al-Aqsa
text: The West's hostility to the Arabs from the Crusades to the flood of Al-Aqsa The West's bias towards Israel is due to a series of factors: the establishment by the West (Britain) of the State of Israel as a thorn in the throat of the Arab world because the West's hostility to Muslim Arabs has a long history from the Crusades and contemporary colonialism to the alliance with Israel in the attack on Egypt in the Suez War and the participation of the White House today in the war of extermination in Summary by القدس العربي [Gaza](https://ground.news/interest/gaza). Since Israel [...] 1 Articles 1 Articles All Left Center Right [] القدس العربي The West's hostility to the Arabs from the Crusades to the flood of Al-Aqsa The West's bias towards Israel is due to a series of factors: the establishment by the West (Britain) of the State of Israel as a thorn in the throat of the Arab world because the West's hostility to Muslim Arabs has a long history from the Crusades and contemporary colonialism to the alliance with Israel in the attack on Egypt in the Suez War and the participation of the White House today in the war of extermination in Gaza.
